page.title: 06Cinque Ports.
page.content: Hythe is one of the Cinque Ports whose history dates back to the 11th century. During the reign of{Edward 1 the confederation had its services and privileges established by{Royal {Charter. }The services consisted of supplying ships and seaman for the defence of the coast and the channel crossing providing the main part of the Royal fleet. In return the portsmen were granted freedom from certain tolls and taxes; a common court of justice held at Shepway near Lympne, and the right to send representatives to the sovereign's coronation and to carry a canopy over the King and another over the Queen in the procession from{Westminster Hall to the{Abbey.}Hythe was used to provide ships and people to look after and protect the south east.
